website_summaries.verdict: Hands down the best deal available. You get 12 reliable bulbs and significant savings from a trusted brand.
pros: Long-lasting, dimmable bulbs from a popular brand
cons: Some users comment that they don't dim as much as they had hoped, but this isn't a major concern

customer_reviews.title: Misleading photos of product
customer_reviews.text: The body of the bulb has writing all over the bottom half of it. Where you see a small “Philips” In the Amazon photos, the back of that same bulb has 12 lines of writing. There is no way for me to screw these bulbs into my fixture without seeing all of the writing since I do not have shades on my bulbs. Unless you plan to cover these up, don’t bother. Waste of my time as I now have to return them. Wish I could rate this NO stars.
customer_reviews.author: Reluctant Shopper

customer_reviews.title: NOT for use in any light where the bulb can be seen - major aesthetic issues
customer_reviews.text: These have a nicely colored light (not too yellow, not too white) BUT what they don't show is that the light is only the top half of the bulb, and the bottom half of the bulb is white and completely covered with writing (warnings, etc). It's extremely visible. I tried to use it in chandeliers where the bulb can be seen and it looks absolutely awful.
customer_reviews.author: Isolde34

customer_reviews.title: Should last longer, bad experience in warranty claim
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pack of 12, one was out after 8 months. Called for warranty replacement of one bulb, Philips Lighting North America refused to send me a replacement bulb. They sent me a few bulks instead. I have no way to buy one replacement bulb with that money. I saw Philips as premium quality lighting product. Now I have changed my mind. Their bulbs do not last longer than those cheap alternatives, such as EcoSmart or Sunoco. Not worth extra to get the Philips brand.
customer_reviews.author: zhd535

customer_reviews.title: Look great but hoped they would last longer.
customer_reviews.text: Lights look good and give off great light. However, I got tired of replacing all of my candelabra lights regularly so I decided to go with LEDs. I bought 60 of these and it has only been a few months and 4 of them are already out. I really expected LED lights to last longer especially due to the increased cost. I was buying a pack of 6 for 2 bucks but hated having to replace as often as I did. Was hoping the LED bulbs would last a lot longer. Maybe I just had 4 bad bulbs and the rest of them will last for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Philips candelabra 4.5w 463901
customer_reviews.text: Used in a ceiling fan/chandelier setup and works great in daylight color. No they're not the prettiest thing to look at but it doesn't bother me much. It helps that all the bulbs are above eye level so not too noticeable. No issues thus far
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Great long lasting bulbs for hard to reach chandeliers
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with these bulbs. I have these installed in multiple light fixtures around the house to include chandeliers (long life so I don't need to get out the ladder every year to change them) I also have these in my exterior fixtures that stay lit all night. Great money saving bulbs in these fixtures. I received 4 of the packages in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: tjm01572

customer_reviews.title: Perfect when used in the proper fixture
customer_reviews.text: These lights are bright and dim perfectly. Must warn, however, that if you have a chandelier in which the bulb is exposed then don't get these. The bulbs are hideous. If your bulbs are covered with a glass or shade and out of sight then don't hesitate to get these!
customer_reviews.author: CognacXO

customer_reviews.title: Let there be light!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bulbs before and so I knew what I would be getting. If you like bright white light (5000 K) then you should get these. However, if you still prefer yellowish (people called it "warm") light then you will be disappointed. They light up my dining room very well. Yes, it's dazzling to look at the light. But hey, light bulbs are designed to illuminate your house, not for you to stare at. I bought another set of generic brand bulbs from the auction site for my breakfast area. I regretted because they are dim, even though the box says 60W equivalence. Lesson learned - name-brand often means guaranteed quality.
customer_reviews.author: HKoldtimer

customer_reviews.title: About these because it says Flicker free and it would ...
customer_reviews.text: About these because it says Flicker free and it would be beneficial to get some lighting for my epileptic disorder. Sadly enough after doing some tests these are not Flicker free which was false advertised
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Returning...not pretty and don’t dim
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the dimmable LED bulbs to brighten and replace the previous non-LED bulbs. I really like how the area looks like daylight in the evening. However, the writing on the bulbs looks ugly because they’re viable on the chandelier which someone else said on a previous comment. The bad thing is they don’t completely shut off. I verified that I ordered dimmable bulbs but they’re still on when I have the switch on “off”.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LED dimming that actually works
customer_reviews.text: The Phillips LED Dimmable B11 Candelabra bulbs are an excellent choice. Sturdy construction, warm light, and no flicker when dimmed. These bulbs appear to produce more light than the 40 watt incandescent bulbs they replaced. There are many "dimmable" LED bulbs listed on Amazon, but these actually perform. Buy these and stop throwing your money away on incandescent bulbs that burn out in a year or much less in a fixture that receives shock (like a porch light) or vibration (like a ceiling fan). Also, you get significant energy savings with 1/8th the power consumption of an incandescent bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Risk

customer_reviews.title: They work...kind of
customer_reviews.text: These lights are bright, but cool temperature which is why I purchased them. The light over the dining room table was too hot in the summer, but we needed the light. The light these bulbs put out is fine except for the "dimable" part. They do dim, but not smoothly with the type of switch we have. Our old incandescents worked fine with it. Might be a switch issue, but I don't think so.
customer_reviews.author: Horse Gal

customer_reviews.title: Good product.  Good service.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent daylight (white light) LED and dimmable works fine. Good service. Good product. The white light versus normal "yellow" makes our modern decor pop with great color.
customer_reviews.author: CanyonCat

customer_reviews.title: Work great and as shown.  Not the greatest design for candle lights though.
customer_reviews.text: LED is so much better than incandescent. Less power, less heat, longer lasting. These are also dimmable so I can use my Smart home controls completely. My only complaint, and reason for the 4 vs. 5 stars, is that the design is not the greatest for a candle light. Usually the fixtures that use these bulbs already have a candle type of appearance which assumes that the bulbs will be the entire flame, but these bulbs have an opaque base that completely destroys this effect of "candle flames." Still, they are functional and that is much more important and they are definitely as described and shown.
customer_reviews.author: K. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Warm Light helps keep it cool.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, installed all the lighting in our new home and used these bulbs in the fixtures. These are the lowest kelvin rated bulbs that I could find in an LED, not as soft as an incandescent but acceptable. I installed dimmer switches for a couple of the fixtures and that helps. Love that they use so little electricity and stay cool. Bathroom especially stays cooler which also helps keep the electric bill low.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for incandescent E12 bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these LED lights bulbs to replace the ones from a chandelier that were incandescent. All fit perfectly and arrived well with no problems! These are daylight so the light is white and not yellow like the incandescent that I previously have. The light is very good, but I feel that is a little bit darker compared with the incandescent version but the consumption is much lower. Recommended product!
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Villegas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement, saving shy of 90%in electricity.
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfect! I replaced my regular candelabra 40w bulbs with these. Throughout my home, there are 18 of these and I was able to replace them without hassle. They are at least as bright and have at least as much light coverage as the incandescent bulbs I was replacing. I'm saving about 90% on these bulbs (4.5w vs 40w). Definetly satisfied with these. Only downfall is (and the reason for the 4 star) that 1 of the 24 bulbs that I purchased, was dead on arival. There's no easy way to replace these since they come in a pack of 12.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: I prefer natural daylight.
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful! Well, except for a few things, as follows - - (3) of the (12) don't work at all, in any position in any chandelier - they all flicker when set anywhere between the dimmest & brightest position - if turned on at the lowest setting, they take up to a minute to turn on But I'm happy with the price and the lovely, lovely light they give, so these things I can deal with.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and efficient
customer_reviews.text: We own a mansion with 15 chandeliers with an average of 8 lights in each. The old lights heated up and burned the fixtures. These lights are brighter and the use less than 10% of the power! They also burn cool so they do not damage the fixtures. I have been using for over a year now and have yet to have one burn out. They do have a pretty good dimming range. Occasionally, they do flutter a little bit, I assume from fluctuations in the electric. After seeing how they worked, I replaced all of my chandelier lights and have been very happy!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not very bright and "dimmable" is a stretch
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other 40-watt equivalent bulbs (including CFLs), these are not very bright. Also, I would not agree that they are dimmable. It's very difficult to discern what is dim and what is bright, and there is a lot of flickering while trying to figure it out. Not at all what I was expecting, so I returned them for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Not what i ordered
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these specifically in daylight light My husbandnhas very sensitive eyes and these are the only kind of bukbs we can use in our house withiut him haveing horrendous headaces from the light being on. I was sent the "soft white" ( still to yellow hued to use) variation instead of the "daylight"which i find very frustrating after searching so long for the daylight in this bulb size. I will be returning these and have purchased with a different seller for the right bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: This Is It...!

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: lights work great but the bottom of the bulb blocks the light I put them on a light fixture where the lights point up so the light under the light fixture is a little dimmer than expected but still enough light for the room. they give off much less heat than my old incandescent bulbs. much cheaper than home depot for the box.
customer_reviews.author: JOE R.

customer_reviews.title: White light instead of yellow.....Nice
customer_reviews.text: These are nice replacement bulbs if your sockets are the smaller threads, as are much of the light fixtures in my new house. I saw one comment prior to mine that said these did not dim.....I put mine in a ceiling fan that has a dim switch and "I HAD NO PROBLEM GETTING MINE TO DIM". So to any further questions to whether or not these are dimmable....YES THEY ARE.
customer_reviews.author: Dash

customer_reviews.title: Cool to the Touch!
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing all of my incandescent lights with these LED bulbs. I have not received an electric bill since I just did the replacement about a week ago. However, the thing that amazes me was how cool to the touch these bulbs were. I've read that most of the energy for traditional light bulbs is wasted in the heat generated. When I replaced the old bulbs, they were literally too hot to touch. These new bulbs were actually cool to the touch after several minutes. If heat means energy, then I expect a great reduction in my electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Joe G., Austin, TX

customer_reviews.title: good lights bright and even
customer_reviews.text: i needed bulbs for outside, the coach lights have designs in the glass and regular LED lights didn't show the reflection of the designs on the ground this acts like a single bulb and my Coach light glass designs are visible the house and concrete
customer_reviews.author: MCM

customer_reviews.title: Don't Work with Lutron Maestro MA-600 Dimmer Switches
customer_reviews.text: I recommend that check the Phillips website first to see if these bulbs work with your dimmer switches. I wanted to use these in my outdoor light fixtures that are controlled by Lutron Maestro dimmer switches. I installed three bulbs but they would not dim or even turn off. After a lot of research & submitting a questions, I found out that these bulbs only work with specific LED dimmer switches. I returned the bulbs and got a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmos Mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my ceiling fans!
customer_reviews.text: I have ceiling fans in all the bedrooms that take 40W candelabra bulbs. The bulbs are exposed, so these mimic the look of a clear incandescent bulb. I believe they are just a bit brighter, and I expect them to last a good long time, especially in a fan. So far they have been in use about a year with no issues. And at only 13.5 watts for three bulbs instead of 120 watts, it will help save on the electric bill too.
customer_reviews.author: D. Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Work great with a Smart dimmer switch
customer_reviews.text: As it says in the description These are not smart bulbs, but they do work with my WeMo smart dimming switch. Great lights. I haven't had a problem with the bulbs flickering. Installed these in my candelabra without shades, and they are perfect lighting for me. Not super bright that they would be discomforting without shades. I installed these on Dec. 25th 2018. I will add more to the description once the first light, of 8, goes out.
customer_reviews.author: crispin

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, I like them. I was worried because they are kind of a strange looking bulb and on our fixture the bulbs are exposed. It's not bad. My fiance really likes the way they look and I can live with it. It's a nice warm light which is what I wanted it's a little bit brighter than the LEDs we just had to replace because they burnt out. It's not on a dimmer so I can't make any comment about that. Pardon the dust in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Mer_Can

customer_reviews.title: Understand what "dimmable" means.
customer_reviews.text: These are significantly brighter than the 40W equivalent incandescent bulbs I had in my ceiling fan. Unfortunately, there must be a technical difference between "dimmable" using an incandescent bulb instead of an LED bulb. With incandescent bulbs in my fixture, I can dim and brighten to my heart's content. With these bulbs, the states are ON and OFF only.
customer_reviews.author: W. Raper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I used these in a dimmable array of light bulbs above the kitchen cabinets. The old bulbs were incandescent and consumed electricity like crazy. These ones are just as bright and perfectly dimmable yet they use much less electricity. This set had exactly as many light bulbs as in my array, so that’s a great value for money. So far I’ve had them for three months, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great, wish they were just a bit brighter
customer_reviews.text: You can't think of LEDs in the same wattage as the old bulbs in terms of brightness. I used these for a bathroom chandelier and wish they were a bit brighter, but they're bright enough. Wife's happy. If you go brighter like 600 lumens, you are into non recognized brands. Wish Philips, a brand I know and trust, had more lumen options. We'll see if the no-name 600 lumen non-dimmables I bought last as long as these.
customer_reviews.author: damianicus

customer_reviews.title: SUPPOSED TO BE DIMABLE
customer_reviews.text: Really thought these were going to be the best quality LED's for my money, but they do not dim very well, if at all, and are exceedingly bright for their rating of 300 lumens/40w equivalent @ 2700k- If I wanted a bright, low energy drain LED with only off/on, in a small form factor, this would be it- However, still searching for a truly dimmable, low watt LED that doesn't buzz or hum...
customer_reviews.author: DESERT-TEK

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little bulb, good value
customer_reviews.text: I used a bunch of these to relight a 2000 sqft lounge space for a friend's project, and it worked GREAT. Lots of light from these little bulbs! Make sure you install a LED-compatible dimmer, and you may need to run a higher draw bulb as the last on the circuit, since they draw so LITTLE power, even in large numbers. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bickers

customer_reviews.title: I used all 12 bulbs and they worked great - I'm very please
customer_reviews.text: I used all 12 bulbs and they worked great - I'm very please, no issues with dimming, I even used the old dimmer I had for the incandescent bulbs without having to replace the dimmer with a modern switch.
customer_reviews.author: OUT2SEE

customer_reviews.title: Finally the bulb I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: The last fixture in our house to go LED was a ceiling fan. I held off because even "premium" incandescent candelabra type bulbs were just so absurdly inexpensive that it hardly seemed worth it. But those old bulbs had such short lifespans. I'm very pleased with these Philip LEDs though. The light is good, they seem to hold up quite well so far, and the price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Quahog

customer_reviews.title: Great lighting
customer_reviews.text: The lighting produced is SO much better than the bulbs that were in the ceiling fan. There are 3, so while I was at it I replaced the 2 still working bulbs as well as the one that went out. I think the old ones were 3700K or less "regular" bulbs. These were slightly larger than the old bulbs so I had to tweak the positioning (angle the bulbs face) slightly to get the "lamp shade" back into position.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs are BRIGHT!!
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs are true daylight bright. The color they put out is definetly a bright white. I am not unhappy with the bulbs, certain applications they will be perfect. I ordered these for the multi bulb fixture over our kitchen table, these are too bright for that fixture & that area. Will keep bulbs for other lighting needs.
customer_reviews.author: Moonalisa99

customer_reviews.title: Good bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace the bulbs in our ceiling fans with LEDs since we suck at remembering to turn off lights, and I'm lazy and don't want to constantly replace burnt-out bulbs. Well, it's been almost four years since I put these in and I've yet to replace any (and we still suck at remembering to turn off the lights).
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Dimmable and work perfectly with Zooz ZEN27 dimmer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a set of these bulbs to replace some no-name B12 candelabra bulbs that - although stated to be dimmable - turned out to flicker badly at lower brightness settings when using a Zooz ZEN27 Z-Wave controllable dimmer. The Philips bulbs worked great in this application; they come on instantly, ramp up and down without flickering, and don't flicker at all at any brightness setting - even very dim.
customer_reviews.author: LeapFrog

customer_reviews.title: The bulbs are working great so far!
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs have been working great with a dimmer switch made for LED bulbs. They've been lighting for us about 3 months now. They don't dim as much as old style bulbs, but that may be because of the switch used. The light color is quite white, but that is what we wanted. It does have some yellow to it so it is on the warm side of the color spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: C ROBERTS

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright Lights
customer_reviews.text: These daylight bulbs really brighten up the room. However, you can see the printing on the lower portion of the bulb. Use them in lights where the lower portion of the bulb is concealed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bean

customer_reviews.title: These give good lught, but get hot at the base and ...
customer_reviews.text: These give good lught, but get hot at the base and they are ugly as sin. I ended up keeping them in a ceiling fan where you cannot see the base. I ended up replacing them in chandelier with decorative glass LEDs purchased for less money at CostlyCo. I should have shopped there first, they look better and were cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Hilgendorf

customer_reviews.title: Got tired of changing coach lights
customer_reviews.text: I finally bit the bullet and went with LED lights for my outside coach lights. We have 3x 3 bulb lights on the front of the garage and it seems like every few months I was on a ladder changing one or two of them out. I'm really hoping that these last at least a few years. Now that incandescent lighta are being phased out, these aren't really that much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: BobC

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking LED replacement bulbs for my ceiling chandelier.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking LED bulbs that give of a similar to incandescent light. My only complaint is that when trying to dim very low, they each have a different starting threshold. This means that some will be lit and some not, so you can't achieve a very low light. But overall, I am very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: halnwheels

customer_reviews.title: Better than some others, but still disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These are better than some other dimmable LEDs I’ve tried, but still kind of disappointing. I have two complaints: 1) they don’t really dim very well. Like other LED bulbs, they dim a little bit and then turn off if you try to dim them as low as you would like them. You can’t really create mood lighting with these. 2) They DO buzz a little. The last dimmable LEDs I bought, I wouldn’t use the light because of the buzzing. With these, it’s very quiet but they still buzz in one of my light fixtures - better, yes but “silent”? No.
customer_reviews.author: nonmae

customer_reviews.title: Soft White LED lights on a Dimmer
customer_reviews.text: It was finally time to relamp the whole house. Tired of burnt out and mismatched bulbs so we replaced every bulb in the house with LED soft white bulbs. These work great in chandelier’s with a dimmer. 5 bulbs at 4.5 watts each now consumes 22.5 watts compared to the previous 200 watts. Hope to see a difference in future power bills.
customer_reviews.author: IamDave

customer_reviews.title: A great value all told.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I replaced old CFL lights in my ceiling fans with these. They are bright without being obnoxious and they also turn on immediately. Two things that used to drive me crazy with the previous bulbs. They seem to be high quality. The soft white is the light output you are looking for if you don't like bluer lighting. A great value all told.
customer_reviews.author: Joe K.

customer_reviews.title: Very white and bright light
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace conventional bulbs on a 'waterfall lamp' and they are very bright. Fortunately I added a dimming module so Alexa can set the brightness. (The bulbs are not smart but a plug in module fixes that!) Since I had extras I also put one in my lamp post and have the nicest lighting on the block! Love the daylight white color of these!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce BTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Love These for Retrofuturism
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bulbs very specifically because the "filament" inside looks so retrofuturistic. They didn't disappoint! They work perfectly, and the filament looks awesome and interesting when lit up. I'm using them in a bare-bulb application in a mid-century space age styled room and they're going to be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Quality Candelabra Base (B11) LED Daylight Bulb
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of B11 (candelabra) base bulbs that will help you save energy use while giving some nice daylight looking illumination. I do wish they were brighter than 300 lumens, but if you're using 3 - 4 of them, then this may not be of too much concern. I have had 1 fail out of this pack, so reliability seems to be good.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Maybe efficient, but not pretty!
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT soft white! The light is blindingly bright with an industrial look. Might be fine in an office setting, but awful in a home setting.
customer_reviews.author: GreenGirl58

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my bathrooms and kitchen and supplements the natural ...
customer_reviews.text: The light color is just on the edge of blue. Works great in my bathrooms and kitchen and supplements the natural light in my living room well. Off-white surfaces appear pure white. 40W equivalent is a hearty, but not overpowering glow.
customer_reviews.author: kayakyakr

customer_reviews.title: If you want bright bulbs, these are the ones to buy.
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are so bright, you would never think that they were Led light bulbs. Thankfully they are dimmable otherwise I would have to remove about 1/2 of the bulb because it would be too bright.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie D

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice in Ceiling Fan Light
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use in the light fixtures below a couple of our ceiling fans. Not too bright and I think they look a lot better than a regular bulb does in the fixture. I purchased these well over a year ago and haven't had to replace any of them. Lower energy use = Lower electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D

customer_reviews.title: Long-lasting and well-crafted
customer_reviews.text: I wish there a little bit cheaper, but then again they are eight uniquely crafted bulb. With that out-of-the-way, just two of these took the place of four bulbs I was using with less than a quarter of the wattage being consumed. I would highly recommend them both as a cost savings and environmental protection.
customer_reviews.author: JDeo

customer_reviews.title: Super power efficent
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for standard bulbs and even brighter. Easily saves me more each month than these bulbs cost. I feel like I made money with this purchase, lol.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: it is fine at the beginning
customer_reviews.text: I only use 10 of these after arrived, it is fine at the beginning, but some of them start blinking after a week.
customer_reviews.author: geniuslion

customer_reviews.title: Great for ceiling fans with standard bulb base
customer_reviews.text: These put out a nice bright light. There are 5 in my ceiling fan. I placed one in a lamp and it is so dim with the shade, it's like a night light. Used in a fan, it works perfect. I wasn't sure about the base size but it's just what I needed. (has the same size base as a standard bulb)
customer_reviews.author: Ray A. Drewry

customer_reviews.title: Work well in ourdoor lights
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers noted the base was big and ugly. Yes it has a big base but they work extremely well in my outdoor garage lights and some upward facing lights on our stairs. If you don't have a fixture that is visible from all angles, these do the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting, Efficient, But Not Extremely Bright
customer_reviews.text: There are LED bulbs that are brighter than these, but I am not disappointed. They perform well in ceiling fixtures with multiple bulbs and are good for mood lighting. Being LED, they should be very efficient and long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Estes

customer_reviews.title: Daylight brightness!
customer_reviews.text: I've used other candelabra type lights that say they were daylight types, but they were never really as bright as I wanted. These are the perfect brightness, just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: TENGUmixD

customer_reviews.title: Did not work in both of my dimmable light fixtures.
customer_reviews.text: Did not dim well. Any dimming: Flickered unless at full-power. 2 actually burned out / stopped working within 2 weeks (probably got worn out from the flickering). Went back to old reliable incandescent bulbs. I know LEDs can be fickle with dimming, but these did not work in 2 separate fixtures (a 5-light chandelier and a 2-light ceiling fan). Both fixtures are different brands.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyMo

customer_reviews.title: Great price compared to big box stores
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the process of converting all the light bulbs in the house to LED for energy savings and longevity. These are the latest edition to the dining room chandelier. They're slightly brighter (in lumens) than 40W incandescent bulbs, but they still produce a soft enough glow that you won't feel like you're in an operating room. Cost wise, they can't be beat. Big box stores sell similar bulbs for 30-50% more so I say these are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Element22

customer_reviews.title: Look fine, not super bright but fine for a small room.
customer_reviews.text: They look pretty good. 40w equivalent is somewhat dim but I've gotten used to it. Very white light. Seems natural enough. No weird patterns or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect LED Bulb
customer_reviews.text: Phillips brand are the only LED bulbs I've bought that actually last. They don't flicker and dim like other brands previously purchased. The bulbs have a nice, soft brightness without being overly harsh to the eyes.
customer_reviews.author: KD99

customer_reviews.title: These do not flicker when dimmed like other "dimmable LED bulbs" do
customer_reviews.text: I had GE LED "dimmable" bulbs and they flickered a lot if they weren't on full power. Even tried 3 different dimmers, here it was the lightbulbs the whole time. The Phillips lightbulbs have a 21st century space-age look about them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott in Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Two bulbs were dead in three weeks. Not a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Chuck1

customer_reviews.title: Good value, they work, look perfect.
customer_reviews.text: For the money I can't find a better deal for lights that put out perfect natural color looking bulbs. With their design it spreads the light very nicely as well. I bought 4 packs of them. Every single one works.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Saiger

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work with Lutron Caseta Wireless
customer_reviews.text: We tried to use these light bulbs with a Lutron Caseta Wireless dimming switch but these light bulbs will not turn off. Incandescent Light bulbs work great but these would not turn off. They would dim but still stay on even after I turned off the light. What the hell?!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: these produce a much more pleasant light and on out 'touch controlled' bedside lamps the work perfect as well as in our office fan lights
customer_reviews.text: Slightly brighter than the bulbs they replaced, these produce a much more pleasant light and on out 'touch controlled' bedside lamps the work perfect as well as in our office fan lights. If they fit your fixture, they're slightly longer by maybe 3/8" than the regular candle bulbs they replace, then I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: SRAdie

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs, great price and delivery is very fast.  Works really well on an LED capable dimmer!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet! Great bulbs at a great price and delivery is very fast. Works really well on an LED capable dimmer (recommend the Lutron C-L dimmer, model TGCL-153PH-LA). The light quality is perfect from the lowest to the highest brightness setting. Awesome. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Picard321

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with Lutron Caseta Dimmers!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product three stars because I have Lutron Caseta installed on my house and this bulbs wont work properly. When you turn them completely off, they remain a bit on. In the picture you can see how it stays when completely off. Dissapointed :(
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: MUCH brighter than crap off-brand "60W" LEDs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 6-pack of off-brand "60W" bulbs thinking I wanted more light than what 40Ws would pump out, but those bulbs suck. These seem to be exceptionally well made (compared to the off-brand crap) and put out a lot more light despite being "only 40W". These are SLIGHTLY longer than a rounded end/"Christmas light"-esque candelabra bulb but they still worked fine in all of my fixtures. These are more the length of the flame tip glass bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: N. W. Campbeln

customer_reviews.title: Small low wattage LED Bulbs that can be used in many applications.
customer_reviews.text: I find that the LED producers are not giving the consumers lots of choices in lower wattage bulbs; i.e less than 5 watts actual. To minimize my LED spare bulb inventory, I have a set of candelabra to standard adapters, that enables using these as candelabras or standard socket applications.
customer_reviews.author: L.J. Conard

customer_reviews.title: Improved light, improved bulb life
customer_reviews.text: I replace the bulbs in my ceiling fan light with these LEDs. Not only is there more light in my room, but I am no longer continually replacing burned out bulbs, which I suspect was due to the amount of electrical current they required. I highly recommend these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: C. Blouke

customer_reviews.title: These work great, are able to be dimmed
customer_reviews.text: I can finally use that chandelier I have. Before I switched to LED, it produced too much heat and would cook you out of house and home. These work great, are able to be dimmed, and give off great light quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Defective bunch ?
customer_reviews.text: We picked this product because of the expected light (life) expectancy. Unfortunately we have had to replace at least a third within the last 5 months. These are used for pathway and lanterns lights in a condo Complex. We need a reliable source of light.
customer_reviews.author: JRW

customer_reviews.title: LED convertion
customer_reviews.text: I have two ceiling fans that take 3 of these each. I'm changing all my lights to LED. My electric bill has dropped by $40.00 per month by doing this. They really light up my bedrooms compared to the regular bulbs that I was replacing about 3 times a year.
customer_reviews.author: Canon54

customer_reviews.title: Great in my ceiling fans
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace bulbs in some ceiling fans. So far, they've been great, brighter than the florescent bulbs I was replacing and none of these LED bulbs have burned out yet. I haven't used the dimmable features of the bulb.
customer_reviews.author: David Sturgill

customer_reviews.title: Great, bright light
customer_reviews.text: These worked well in our new chandalier, give off a bright light. Somewhat taller than the shades around the bottom so the tips are barely visible from ground level. Gives a nice look. Have yet to determine if these are dimmable, will update if they flicker.
customer_reviews.author: Klinkstar

customer_reviews.title: Very short life
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite disappointed these lasted just under 5 months. I would have thought that being LED they would last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Too blue and not bright enough indoors.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I like these. There are 6 of these LEDs in the chandalier in the front. It gives off a very distinct blue light and lots of shadowing. In fact, the room got darker when I replaced my 40 watt incandescents with these LEDs. The light in the back still has 3 incandescent 40 watt bulbs and even with a cover is giving off better lighting. I gave it 3 stars because it looks better in my fixtures outside. I think I prefer the "daylight" bulbs outdoors only.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Great Dimmable LED Lighting
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely a must buy. They lighting is soft as stated in description . The fact that they are dimmable was a bonus. Great price,too!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Nice bulbs...
customer_reviews.text: I got these bulbs to replace some older flame-shaped bulbs that had burned-out. These don’t have that flame shape to them, but they look nice in the chandelier. Unlike some other reviews, these dim all the way up and down with no problems, so maybe it’s actually their dimmer switch that is faulty. Overall, these are nice bulbs for replacing the outdated, non-led bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W.

customer_reviews.title: Overall great quality and plenty bright
customer_reviews.text: Philips clearly took extensive steps to prevent breakage. Bulbs are packed in the center of a honeycomb with a base for the bottom of the bulbs to keep everything from shifting. Installation is nothing of course, I tested with a normal dimmer and had no problems or flickering. Overall great quality and plenty bright, much cleaner light than regular bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: XCD83784

customer_reviews.title: I love these bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to replace those pesky mercury-containing CFL bulbs. They are plastic so you don't have to worry about them breaking and don't get very hot. No flickering either. Will be buying these again to replace my older bulbs as they burn out.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Good LED lights, just as described
customer_reviews.text: LED lights work just as described. I use the chandelier every day and am now saving lots of energy. In retrospect I might have looked for a more charming incandescent style with all-clear glass.
customer_reviews.author: William K. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I like them a lot just wish they were cheaper cuz they aren’t that bright tbh and my chandelier is like half full and having all filled will probably be exactly as bright as I want it
customer_reviews.author: Gindi F.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: After 2 days of using them for less than 2 hours a day one bulb has burned..
customer_reviews.author: Subhi N. SALOOM

customer_reviews.title: Great price for this size LED bulbs!
customer_reviews.text: Love finding these LED chandelier bulbs. This size with the wider base is expensive to buy locally in a 2 pack. The narrow chandelier base is easier to find. This was an excellent price for 12 and I know I will have extras when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: JRF, Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs, great savings!
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the quality of these bulbs. I saved a lot of money by buying this 12 bulb package, as opposed to buying the bulbs in a store. I have 8 of the bulbs installed, and so far they work just fine. My wall dimmer switch doesn't work, so I can't speak to their ability to dim. I need to get that switch replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Auntkay53

customer_reviews.title: The look good in the chandelier above the dining room table
customer_reviews.text: ... I say Good instead of Great because if looking at them closely, they don’t look like an ordinary bulb. But the color temperature and coverage of the light is great.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great lighting.  Saves a lot of money on electric bills.
customer_reviews.text: Great lighting. Look good too. Saves a lot of money on electric bills. Let's see how long they really last.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: The bulbs themselves appear good quality. The color is REALLY white/bright
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs themselves appear good quality. The color is REALLY white/bright. I put them in my vanity sconce and it is way too bright and bugs my eyes out. Perhaps in overhead room lights they would be ok. For bathroom lighting i would stick with warm light as opposed to daylight LED.
customer_reviews.author: savin' a dime

customer_reviews.title: all worked very well right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: they work well. had regular incandescent bulbs before which never lasted very long. im hoping these will last longer being LED. plus if someone forgets to turn them off, not as big of a deal with the lower power consumption. i bought these for a pair of patio ceiling fans.
customer_reviews.author: steve m

customer_reviews.title: Just hope they last
customer_reviews.text: I hope they do save on energy & money. Working well so far for about 6 months. Let's hope they last.
customer_reviews.author: Tristanicus

customer_reviews.title: Good for on/off, BUZZ when dimmed.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and quantity of light, however in my dimmable lamp they BUZZZZZZ when not all the way on. ANNOYING. I replaced them with just basic cheapies and they dont humm. I will use for other fixtures around the house with just on/off switch. Would not advise using these for dimmable lamps.
customer_reviews.author: review

customer_reviews.title: Bright
customer_reviews.text: So far so good.These bulbs are very bright-I use them as night lights since they only use about 5 watts but have the equivalent light output of a regular incandescent 40 watt bulb.As long as I get long life from these bulbs I'll be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Paintmixerbob

customer_reviews.title: Another quality product from Phillips
customer_reviews.text: A little brighter than anticipated but no complaints. No DOA, no flickering. Stay away from any other manufacturers are knockoffs. Phillips is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Ridgeway H

product_meta.title: Philips LED Dimmable B11 Clear Candle Light Bulb: 300-Lumen, 2700-Kelvin, 4.5-Watt (40-Watt Equivalent), E12 Base, Soft White, 12-Pack
product_meta.description: Color:Soft White| Size:12 Pack| Style:Blunt Tip/Candelabra BasePhilips B11 Decorative Candle LED light bulbs are made to be seen with a warm glowing filament that shines with 300 lumens of soft white dimmable light, equivalent to 40-watt incandescent with 80% less energy use. These bulbs fit small candelabra (E12) fixtures. Philips LED dimming is flicker-free, silent, and tested work with more dimmer switches than any other LED on the market. The light dims smoothly from 2700-Kelvin down to a soft glow with greater clarity than traditional incandescent light bulbs. These best-in-class, Energy Star Certified Philips LEDs provide steady, natural lighting at 1/4 of the energy of incandescent, 1/2 the energy of halogens and with 10X and 4X the lifespan respectively. Philips LEDs are mercury-free so they don't contribute to harmful hazardous waste. B11 soft white light bulbs are ideal use in candelabras and other decorative fixtures. Philips LED bulbs last 10x longer than incandescent and 4X longer than halogens making them a great choice for multi-socket candelabra lighting fixtures. Not for use with Philips Hue products. This pack of 12 B11 Philips LEDs comes with a 10-year warranty. Each bulb is expected to deliver a lifetime of up to 25,000 hours, saving you the cost and hassle of frequent bulb replacement.
feature_bullets: Energy Efficient: Philips LED Dimmable B11 Light Bulbs uses 80 percent less energy than 40 Watt Incandescent Bulbs while maintaining the look and feel of a classic light bulb; Philips LED light bulbs are Mercury free and Energy Star Certified

Long Lasting: These Philips LED bulbs last 10x longer than incandescent and 4x longer than halogen bulbs; Each light bulb is expected to deliver a lifetime of Upto 25,000 hours and includes a 10 year warranty, saving you the cost of frequent bulb replacement

Soft White: Philips LED Dimmable B11 light bulbs offer warm and comfortable lighting with high CRI (color rendering index); At 2700 Kelvin the bulbs deliver bright, crisp color ideal for multi socket candelabra lighting fixtures

Smooth Dimming: Philips dimmable LED bulbs are flicker free, silent, and tested to work with more dimmer switches than any other LED bulb on the market; These B11 light bulbs smoothly dim from 2700K down to a soft glow with greater clarity than traditional incandescent bulbs

Comfortable Light: Our products meet strict test criteria including flicker, strobe, glare and color rendition to ensure they meet EyeComfort requirements; Switch to Philips LED, light that’s designed for the comfort of your eyes
Compatibility: These Philips LED light bulbs fit in E12 candelabra bases; Not compatible with Philips HUE products; Philips LED Dimmable B11 light bulbs are for non connected use only

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,742 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
